H0.text: Hydrocarbons are molecules made of one carbon and four hydrogen atoms.

H1.text: Fats are molecules made of one carbon and four hydrogen atoms.

H2.text: Proteins are molecules made of one carbon and four hydrogen atoms.

H3.text: Particles are molecules made of one carbon and four hydrogen atoms.

A4.text: The simplest hydrocarbon, methane, burns as follows: CH4 + 2O2 ‚ü∂ CO2 + 2H2O

A5.text: The formula for acyclic saturated hydrocarbons (i.e., alkanes) is CnH2n+2

A6.text: Methane (US: METH-ayn, UK: MEE-thayn) is a chemical compound with the chemical formula CH4 (one carbon atom bonded to four hydrogen atoms).

A7.text: Cycloalkanes have the general formula CnH2n.

A8.text: Ethane has the formula C2H6, which differs from CH4.
